column4: still no joy. created a new script called blue in same location. Made it executable and still get a similar error "sudo: unable to execute ./blue: no such file or directory"
the file you are trying to execute does not exist
I can see the file not sure why sudo doesnt find it
.blue gives the following "bash: ./blue: /bin/bash^M: bad interpreter: No such file or directgory"
sorry my previous comment was wrt ./blue
did you make that file in windows and then transfer?  the ^M line character escapes are dos
Enselic__:  the ^M line breaks are dos characters so it cannot find bin/bash.  either get dos2unix, or just open a new file in linux
yeah make a new file in linux
you might be able to just retype that first line #!/bin/bash
and retype or will cut and paste from blue work with new file?
cut and paste might copy those ^M characters
Enselic__ , I just created a new script from scratch with the bin/bash line and an echo statement and the echo displayed to screen. I'm going to retype my original script from scratch. I
if you do 'apt-get install tofrodos'  then run dos2unix blue, it will convert from dos 2 unix format
understood, however that laptop not connected to net yet. I'm doing all this to get its wireless card up and running.
thanks for the help. The script is running. There seems to be a problem with the script but I've run out of time today so I'll tackle that next time.
